text: [Music]
once deep in the forest lived a monkey
named Robbie Robbie was always helpful
to other animals he would help the
elephant pluck fresh fruits look after
the little fawns
while mother deer was out and helped the
rabbit cross the river
Robbie's home was a big and strong tree
which stood right in the center of the
forest every animal knew that if Robbie
was not found anywhere he would be
sitting on the tree playing his flute
that was another thing about Robbie
he played melodious tunes upon his flute
there you are Robbie tortoise was
looking for you he needs you to help
with his guard his guard well I couldn't
wait for him to finish the sentence but
I am guessing he meant oh yes he told me
about it yesterday let's go tell me one
thing why do you always play your flute
at this very spot I don't know I love
this tree and you may think I am crazy
but I feel this jury listens to my tunes
oh you were right what you feel that too
no I mean you are right I think you are
crazy but Robbie was right the tree did
listen to his music this was a secret
which even Robbie didn't know the music
had touched the tree spirit it would
listen to the tune intently and be happy
to have Robbie play it every day one day
as Robbie was asleep on the tree there
was a terrible noise beneath
what is that earthquake earthquake who
is this man you this will take some time
Robbie Xun understood what was going on
he quickly hopped down hey what are you
doing why are you cutting this tree my
master would like to use it for his boat
this tree has a strong bark no you can't
cut it oh really and why is that listen
I have spent many days trying to find a
strong support for the boat and you
don't own this tree don't waste my time
Robbie was a smart monkey he decided to
scare the woodcutter away hey I did try
to stop you but you will meet your
destiny I suppose what is that supposed
to mean
don't you know a spirit of an old man
lives in this tree he has been here for
years if you cut this tree down where
will he go
he will latch himself on to you of
course latch on to me naturally since
you are the one cutting this tree are
you trying to fool me I am smarter than
you think monkey I am NOT going to fall
for this story go away now Robbie was
desperate to save his home as soon as
the woodcutter got busy
Robbie climbed the tree and went
straight to the top he hid himself in
the dense leaves and began to scream
Oh dare you touch my home what who is
that
if you destroy my home I will have to
come live with you I will never leave
you human the the monkey was right
don't worry human we will be good
friends
what's the hurry my friend what about
your boat just as Robbie was laughing at
the woodcutter the tree came alive
Robbie what part are you really the
spirit of some old man so so all this
time I was sitting and sleeping on an
old man skirt no Robbie I am NOT an old
man spirit I mean I am old but I am the
spirit of this tree your music brought
me alive you are a wise monkey Robbie
and I am grateful to you you saved me
from the woodcutter here accept this as
a thank-you gift a bell not just an
ordinary Bell this is the magic Bell
every time you ring it the sky will
magically give you fresh fruits to eat
oh wow will help me and all the other
animals in the forest yes it will but
remember Robbie you can ring this Bell
only once in a day I will remember that
thank you tree Robbie ran to call his
other friends in the forest
piglet Fox Ellie come here everyone
I was taking a breath ravi narrated the
whole incident the animals were all
shocked they couldn't believe that the
tree spirit had come alive you did the
right thing Ravi we are all very proud
of you humans nothing twice before
cutting trees down if the forest is gone
there will be no rain that true but I am
more excited about the bell does it work
we should try it
Ravi was excited too he rang the bell at
once and instantly it was raining fruits
there were oranges pears apples
pineapples falling from the sky the
animals were all very happy Fox ran and
brought a basket to catch the fruits
elephant caught a pineapple in his trunk
and took a bite while Ravi simply opened
his mouth to eat a pear the animals ate
with all their hearts no need to hunt
for fresh fruits anymore
it was through everyday Robi would
simply ring his magic bell and it would
rain fruits this went on for days the
animals trusted Ravi and were very happy
with him one afternoon as Robbie was
swinging from tree to tree he saw a big
banana tree at a distance the right
yellow bananas made him very hungry but
instead of climbing the tree and getting
those freshly ripened bananas
he thought of something else the magic
Bell let me ring it and bring down a
fresh bunch of bananas from the
sky-eye can store the ones on the tree
for later
where are the fruits stop working oh
wait I rang the bell in the morning once
you can ring the bell only once in a day
no but I am so hungry
just as Robbie was thinking what he
could do he saw his friend the Fox lying
on the ground hey do you have any
bananas left from today's rain I don't
have any food makes me sleepy hey Robbie
see you later you know what let's try
and get a fresh watermelon tomorrow hi
miss watermelon watermelon well I miss
food I am the one who saved a tree from
the woodcutter I am the rightful owner
of the magic Bell and I am the only one
who sees hungry this is not fair not
fair at all Robbie was so annoyed that
he forgot he could easily climb up the
tree and get those bananas for himself
the next morning
Robbie stood close to his tree and rang
the bell instantly many fruits fell from
the sky he ate as many as he could and
gathered the rest he then hid all the
fruits behind the tree Robbie what are
you doing your friends must be hungry
but what if I get hungry during the day
this is selfish Robbie there are enough
fruits for everyone you must share I
know what I am doing
you gave that bell to me it is not fair
for me to be hungry
just then all the animals came to Robbie
to ask for fruits diam sorry friends but
the Bell isn't working
I rang it so many times Lucy I will
bring it again to show you
Robbie rang the bell but since all the
fruits had already rained down naturally
nothing happened
the animals were sad but nobody doubted
the monkey as they were leaving wait I
smell something funny what's that behind
the tree Robbie hey come here there are
lots of fruits
Robbie was hiding them from us
all the animals came back and were
shocked Robbie if you didn't want to
share food you could have said so you
didn't have to lie to us I would have
happily given you my share of food I
would have given it to you know what my
friend why don't along you eat all the
fruits from now on we don't want
anything from you as Robbie saw his
friends leaving he realized his mistake
and began to cry wait I am so sorry I
acted selfish there are enough fruits
for all of us to share even if it rains
fruits every minute it won't be the same
if I don't share with you all please
forgive me
Robbie it's alright
we forgive you you have always been dear
to us yes my friend we are not angry
anymore
yeah can you eat now hunger makes me all
the animals shared the fruits and ate
till their stomachs were full
Robbie never used the bell for his own
selfish needs again the end
[Music]
you
